page.title: 11ABBEY BRIDGE
page.content: Abbey Bridge(ref:065,149)is a graceful single arched bridge made of stone.It is 78 metres long and 5 metres wide in the centre,spanning the River Tees which here flows through a limestone gorge.Heavy traffic has been diverted over the bridge.This has weakened the bridge which has now been strenghthened by wooden beams.Abbey{Bridge}was opened on June 19th 1773.It used to be a toll bridge with a fee of 1/2d for pedestrians.The road over the bridge is between Greta Bridge and Barnard Castle.There are impressive views up-stream and down-stream from the bridge.
